metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7493 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Quick Emulator (Qemu) built with the VirtFS, host directory sharing viaPlan 9 File System(9pfs) support, is vulnerable to an improper accesscontrol issue. It could occur while accessing virtfs metadata files inmapped-file security mode. A guest user could use this flaw to escalatetheir privileges inside guest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-kvm - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-system - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-system-aarch64 - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-system-common - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-user - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-user-static - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
qemu-utils - 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1').
